sentences.english: Provide the FT with all materials required to prepare and teach lessons.
sentences.chinese: 爲外師提供備課和教課所需材料。

sentences.english: When she teaches, she tries to speak easy English very slowly.
sentences.chinese: 教課的時候，她會設法以簡單的英語慢慢說。

sentences.english: This course will be taught and discussed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 教課方式分十八週以課堂講授及討論爲主。

sentences.english: So she started teaching a class at Portland State University.
sentences.chinese: 因此，她開始在波特蘭州立大學教課。

sentences.english: "It was taught by a fungal geneticist, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “教課的是一位兇猛的遺傳學家”，他說。

sentences.english: But what makes good TV doesn't necessarily make for good teaching.
sentences.chinese: 然而做紀錄片得心應手不代表必然能教課左右逢源。

sentences.english: I have back-to-back tutoring sessions today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天要連着上家教課。

sentences.english: How do you think, if we add Salsa classes and Salsa party on Friday?
sentences.chinese: 每週五教課加派對，週六派對，您覺得怎麼樣？

sentences.english: And she is never late. Then we come to see that Mrs Wang loves us dearly.
sentences.chinese: 逐漸我們發現王老師很愛我們，她教課特別認真。

sentences.english: They teach classes. They advise students.
sentences.chinese: 他們教課，指導學生，還要做研究。

definition: (Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
